school_or_self_taught: Have you studied data visualization in school (or other formal environment) or did you learn how to do it on your own?
learning_method: What methods do you think best teach data visualization?
skills_to_improve: What area is your next priority for improving your data visualization skills?
full_or_part_data_vis: What focus is data visualization in your work?
hired_or_part: For the majority of your projects: were you hired to do data visualization only or is data visualization a part of your job/project description?
more_or_less: Do you do more or less data visualization than you expected for this role?
role: Which one of these is the closest to describing your role?
org_use_data_vis: How is your organization using data visualization? Select all that apply.
org_structure: Is there a separate group dedicated to creating data visualization or are data visualization specialists embedded in another group? (data science, UX, UI, web, data engineering, IT, etc)
modes_data_vis: What modes of data visualization are in use at your organization? Select all that apply.
leadership_understanding: Leadership in your organization has a strong understanding of the value of data visualization.
areas_in_org_using: Data visualization at your organization features prominently in what parts of the organization? Select all that apply.
total_hours_data_vis: Hours a week focused on creating/implementing/productizing data visualizations?

data_science_hours: Hours a week focused on data science?
design_hours: Hours a week focused on design?
data_prep_hours: Hours a week focused on data prep work?
portfolio_hours: Hours a week focused on building your portfolio?
technologies: What technologies do you use to visualize data? Select all that apply.
preselected_tool_status: Are you able to choose your own tools or are the choices made for you?
presentation_type: How do you present your data visualizations? Select all that apply.
production_charts: Which of these charts have you used in production in the last 6 months? Select all that apply.
audience: Who do you make data visualizations for? Select all that apply.
audience_knowledge: What knowledge level does your audience have of the data you are visualizing for them? Select all that apply.
audience_utilization: Most typically, how often does your audience use your data visualization?
audience_use_case: What does your audience use your data visualization for? Select all that apply.
stakeholders_relationship: How would you describe your relationship with stakeholders?
tool_needs_met: I have adequate resources to explore the data visualization options I want to use.
frustration: What is your biggest frustration with doing data visualization in your job?
change_in_work: If you could change one thing about your data visualization work what would it be?
misunderstanding_of_work: What do you think other people in your organization just donâ€™t get about the data visualization work that you do?
time_energy_resource_inadequate: I want to make better visualizations but donâ€™t have the time/energy/resources.
looking_new_tools_techinques: Iâ€™m always on the lookout for new data visualization tools and techniques that will make my workflows faster and more efficient.
skills_lacking: My skills hold me back much more than my tools do.
performance_enhancer: What one change would make the data visualization aspect of your job better?
community_support: What community support / discussions / advice would you want to see from data visualization thought leaders?
leaders: Who do you look to as a thought leader in data visualization?
more_or_less_visualizing: Do you want to spend more time or less time visualizing data in the future?
years_experience: How many years of experience do you have doing professional data visualization?
org_type: The organization you work for is in which of the following areas?
undergrad_degree: If you went to college, what did you major in during your undergraduate work?

country: What country do you live in?
